availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, carpenter and drinking saloon owner. Germantown, Pennsylvania native. Married to Jane Hubbard Crout. Father of William Crout, Elizabeth Crout, Kate Crout, Julia Crout, Edward Crout, and Daniel Crout. Carpenter in Covington in 1860. Drinking saloon owner in Covington in 1870.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 3, page 276.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, page 6.
Kentucky Death Records (1888-1889), Covington, Certificates 1-797, certificate no. 554.
Find A Grave, “Henry Crout (September 20, 1815-September 11, 1888),” Memorial #10770969, http://findagrave.com/memorial/10770969 (accessed February 16, 2018).
